result.execSummary:
The defendant Rickey Terraine Perry Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $854.23 payable to Community Financial Service, payable first and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees. Cash bail applied.

Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered. Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes:
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

supervisions.notes:
- No firearm; weapons.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court also advised the defendant that because he was convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 he may not possess a firearm within 5 years of completing sentence or he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rickey Terraine Perry Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (33 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing 05-24-2016 received and filed.
Restitution Refund Packet

Defendant Rickey Terraine Perry in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Rickey Terraine Perry in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Statements made as to sentencing.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, with credit for 195 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Restitution payable to Community Financial Service for $854.23 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  The Court also advised the defendant that because he was convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 he may not possess a firearm within 5 years of completing sentence or he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Rickey Terraine Perry in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Rickey Terraine Perry in custody.  Abbey Desiato for Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Jury instruction received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Judgment of conviction entered.  PSI was ordered without recommendation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle Louise Shelton in court, defendant Rickey Terraine Perry not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant not produced, counsel waives appearance for hearing.

Defense has been unable to meet with client at CJF and request an adjournment.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

**JUDGE DONALD'S COURT FOR JUDGE BROSTROM'S COURT.....
Attorney Danielle Louise Shelton appeared TELEPHONICALLY on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant Rickey Terraine Perry not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

PER THE PERMISSION OF JUDGE BROSTROM, CLERK ADJOURNED TODAY'S PLEA HEARING OFF THE RECORD.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea Hearing today.
Atty. Shelton is ill.
Case adjourned to 03-17-2016 at 1:30 PM - Br. 6, Judge Brostrom's Court for Adjourned Plea Hearing.

Defendant Rickey Terraine Perry in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Rickey Terraine Perry in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defense request an adjourned plea date.  Case is adjourned for a PLEA HEARING in branch 6.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

BRANCH 28 HELD IN BRANCH 26.  Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Rickey Terraine Perry not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel would like this case transferred to Branch 6 pending a global  resolution with case 15CF5062.    No objection from the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 6.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood not in court, but telephoned the court.   Defendant Rickey Terraine Perry not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel contacted the court via telephone conference to inform he is in trial in Branch 38 on an unrelated case and requests adjournment.
Case adjourned for status in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms
Status conference scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Rickey Terraine Perry not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties inform Court that defendant has a case pending in Branch 6.
Defense counsel requests adjournment of the scheduled trial as to this case; no objection by the State.
Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28.  Jury trial is vacated.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Rickey Terraine Perry not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  Attorney Lockwood just appointed to case.  He is unable to accomodiate the currently scheduled jury trial date.  Matter scheduled for another final pretrial.  

Parties are informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders, Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rickey Terraine Perry in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests a final pretrial and a jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Parties request an adjournment of the currently scheduled Projected Guilty Plea and Sentencing.  Defendant has some community service to complete before this matter can go to plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rickey Terraine Perry in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however Branch 21 is in jury trial, case adjourned. Court cancelled the previously stayed bench warrant.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared via telephone for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not appearing.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court granted the defense request for a continuance of the stayed bench warrant until the next court date.  Case remains scheduled for plea and sentencing in Brach 21 on 07/08/2015.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 06/29/15/2015.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court. Defense counsel has not had a chance to contact the defendant and she was just informed of the violation now.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court to address Justice Point violation (missed telephone contact).  Defense counsel is mailing a letter to the defendant to address this issue, and requested that the Court wait to hear the matter until next week. The State does not object. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
